Package com.unitedinternet.azubiakademie.boundary

Class ApiResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.unitedinternet.azubiakademie.boundary.ApiResource
  • @Controller
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class ApiResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The API resources is responsible for the HTTP interface, through which the entries are managed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    dkunze

    • Method Detail

      • addPresentation

        @RequestMapping(value="/add",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addPresentation​(@RequestParam("date")
                                        java.lang.String date,
                                        @RequestParam("speaker1")
                                        java.lang.String speaker1,
                                        @RequestParam("speaker2")
                                        java.lang.String speaker2,
                                        @RequestParam("speaker3")
                                        java.lang.String speaker3,
                                        @RequestParam("topic1")
                                        java.lang.String topic1,
                                        @RequestParam("topic2")
                                        java.lang.String topic2,
                                        @RequestParam("topic3")
                                        java.lang.String topic3,
                                        @RequestParam("comment")
                                        java.lang.String comment,
                                        org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This function adds a new entrie. The function is called via the http-request-method "post".
        Parameters:
        date - Day of the presentation as String in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".
        speaker1 - Name of the first speaker as String.
        speaker2 - Name of the second speaker as String.
        speaker3 - Name of the third speaker as String.
        topic1 - Topic of the first presentation as String.
        topic2 - Topic of the second presentation as String.
        topic3 - Topic of the third presentation as String.
        comment - Notes on lectures
        model - The function of model is to get information's from the backend to the frontend.
        Returns:
        index.html - Redirects to the index page.

      • removePresentation

        @RequestMapping("{presId}/delete")
public java.lang.String removePresentation​(@PathVariable("presId")
                                           java.lang.Long id,
                                           org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This function deletes aa entry. In the url it is required to provide an id of a entry. The function is called via the http-request-method "post".
        Example: serverDomain/2/delete - entry with the id 2 will get deleted
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the entry that shall be deleted
        model - The function of model is to get information's from the backend to the frontend.
        Returns:
        index.html - Redirects to the index page.

      • editPresentation

        @RequestMapping("/edit")
public java.lang.String editPresentation​(@RequestParam("date")
                                         java.lang.String date,
                                         @RequestParam("speaker1")
                                         java.lang.String speaker1,
                                         @RequestParam("speaker2")
                                         java.lang.String speaker2,
                                         @RequestParam("speaker3")
                                         java.lang.String speaker3,
                                         @RequestParam("topic1")
                                         java.lang.String topic1,
                                         @RequestParam("topic2")
                                         java.lang.String topic2,
                                         @RequestParam("topic3")
                                         java.lang.String topic3,
                                         @RequestParam("status1")
                                         int status1,
                                         @RequestParam("status2")
                                         int status2,
                                         @RequestParam("status2")
                                         int status3,
                                         @RequestParam("comment")
                                         java.lang.String comment,
                                         @RequestParam("id")
                                         java.lang.Long id,
                                         org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This function edits an entry. The function is called via the http-request-method "post".
        Parameters:
        date - Day of the presentation as String in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".
        speaker1 - Name of the first speaker as String.
        speaker2 - Name of the second speaker as String.
        speaker3 - Name of the third speaker as String.
        topic1 - Topic of the first presentation as String.
        topic2 - Topic of the second presentation as String.
        topic3 - Topic of the third presentation as String.
        status1 - Status of the first presentation as Integer.
        status2 - Status of the second presentation as Integer.
        status3 - Status of the third presentation as Integer.
        comment - Notes on lectures.
        id - Id of the entry that shall be edited.
        model - The function of model is to get information's from the backend to the frontend.
        Returns:
        index.html - Redirects to the index page.
